ce of code could generate. So, the most fundamental ones are those to do

estion is can you anticipate this? So,

ernative paths,   a contingency plan as it were saying if this

ive action. So, what happens when code generates an

So, it is in our interest to avoid that and

28285479-af5c-4d81-94b5-b61c982c8cd8.title: Exception Handling

we are using   this exception to signal which of

ess what you are saying

e which one is more   easy for you to understand, but this is just to

t 
us see how this whole thing actually works. So,   supposing I have this main code which calls 
a function f so this will transfer control   to f which is defined somewhere else. Now, f in 
turn may call another function g, so this will   again transfer

a4e259f8-554b-4e95-98f3-8e8bce2db2ae.title: Exception Handling
a4e259f8-554b-4e95-98f3-8e8bce2db2ae.chunk:
control to g which is defined 
yet another place, and g in turn may call an   h, so we have the sequence of calls so this 
called this, this called this, this called this. So, we started with calling f 
and eventually unknown to us   in some sequence h has

e4562cdd-41a7-4a9e-a4b1-0fa95edbae3a.title: Exception Handling

got called. And now h 
generates an error and it does not internally   handle it. So, what happens to this error? So, 
what happens to this error is that we said before   that if an error is not handled then something 
will abort, but in this case it kind

f12fbb7a-f852-4a65-8855-8973a778a641.title: Exception Handling
f12fbb7a-f852-4a65-8855-8973a778a641.chunk:
of is unfair   to ask this to abort because an error happened 
deep down, so it will actually abort in stages. So, this error will get passed back to g, so the 
call that g made to h will terminate in a kind of   incomplete fashion and now it is up to g t

36c5f486-bd6b-4a29-a54a-5ed73c2b2171.title: Exception Handling
36c5f486-bd6b-4a29-a54a-5ed73c2b2171.chunk:
o figure 
it out. So, it inherits this index error. So,   g will see with respect to h an index error, 
so supposing there had been a try here,   except index error then g would have been 
able to handle this. But maybe g did not. So,   if g did not handle

f4e2d051-5e00-43ae-bd6f-746b764bee1f.title: Exception Handling
f4e2d051-5e00-43ae-bd6f-746b764bee1f.chunk:
it then the same index error 
goes back to whatever called g. So, in this case   it goes back to f. So, again the possibility is 
that there was a try here which handles this. But if there was not then it goes back to where it 
called. So, the sequence is

7f1ea5d2-6e00-48ce-9a34-691b6649cd2d.title: Exception Handling
7f1ea5d2-6e00-48ce-9a34-691b6649cd2d.chunk:
that the index error   or whatever error it is goes back up the calling 
stack as it were. So, you keep calling functions   and the error goes back in the same sequence 
and wherever it is handled it will get handled,   if it does not get handed it 
will

ea9086e6-b241-4242-9877-19adcd9317c8.title: Exception Handling
